security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing no executable code. Contains only markdown guidance, TypeScript interface examples, and SQL schema definitions for GDPR compliance features. No scripts, network calls, filesystem access, environment variable access, or code execution paths detected.

content.value_statement: Developers need clear guidance on implementing data subject rights and consent management. This skill provides ready-to-use TypeScript interfaces, SQL schemas, and code review checklists for GDPR compliance in web applications.
actual_capabilities: Documents GDPR Article 15-20 data subject rights with implementation patterns
Provides TypeScript interfaces for consent records and data export
Includes SQL schemas for deletion requests and anonymization tracking
Offers code review checklist for GDPR compliance verification
Details API endpoints for data export, deletion requests, and consent withdrawal
limitations: Skill is documentation-only and does not execute compliance operations
Does not provide legal advice or certification
Requires developer implementation following provided patterns

use_cases.title: Verify GDPR coverage
use_cases.description: Review code against compliance checklist covering all GDPR data subject rights

best_practices: Capture consent before any data processing with method and timestamp recorded
Implement 30-day deletion window for Article 17 compliance
Anonymize audit trails rather than deleting them to maintain security logs
anti_patterns: Deleting user data without proper audit trail preservation
Processing personal data without documented lawful basis
Failing to provide machine-readable format for data portability

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. All tools can read the documentation and apply patterns.

faq.question: What GDPR articles are covered?
faq.answer: Articles 15-20 including right of access, rectification, erasure, and data portability.

faq.question: Does this skill execute compliance operations?
faq.answer: No. This is documentation-only. You must implement the patterns yourself in your codebase.

faq.question: Is the data handled securely?
faq.answer: The skill itself touches no data. It only provides patterns. Your implementation must secure data.

faq.question: Can I use this for legal compliance certification?
faq.answer: No. This provides technical patterns only. Consult legal counsel for actual compliance certification.

faq.question: How does this compare to privacy-by-design frameworks?
faq.answer: This skill implements GDPR-specific requirements. Privacy-by-design is a broader architectural approach.
